English: 프랑스의 현대사는 1871년의 파리 코뮌 1916년에 벌어진 베르瓦【의 혈투 그리고 1940년에 독일군에게 항복 이 세가지 사건에 의해서 형성되었다고 할 수 있다. 1939년에 제 2차 세계대전에 참전하게 된 프랑스는 1914년의 프랑스가 아니었다. 예전의 신성동맹은 존재하지 않았으며 국가 역시 내부에서 분열되고 있었다. 1934년 블럼의 내각이 출범하면서 프랑스는 좌우로 분열되기 시작했다. 프랑스 우파에서는 히틀러보다는 블럼이 낫다는 말이 떠돌아다녔다. 독일군이 프랑스로 진군해오자 프랑스의 우파 사이에는 새로운 코뮌이 등장할 것이라는 두려움이 번지기 시작했다. 베르窩 영웅 이며 파리 코뮌을 기억할 정도로 늙은 페탱 원수는 코뮌이 다시 부활해서는 안 된다는 결정을 내렸다. 페탱은 프랑스를 다시 한번 구하기 위해 정치적 영향력을 행사하기 시작했다. 새로운 프랑스 정부는 독일과 재빠르게 평화를 이루어 냈으며 나중에 이 정부의 이름이 될 온천도시 비시를 기반 삼았다. 거의 반 이상의 프랑스 영토가 승자에 의해 합병되거나 점령당했고 막대한 배상금을 물어야 했으며 주변국들은 프랑스의 식민지 제국을 노리며 다가왔다. 일본은 인도차이나 반도를 가져갈 준비를 마쳤으며 이탈리아는 튀니지에 대한 욕심을 가지고 있었다. 에스파냐는 모로코로 세력을 확장하려 했으며 독일은 결국 그들이 가지고 있었던 중앙 아프리카의 식민지를 되돌려달라고 요구할 것이었다. 추축국과 그 이념적 동맹국들은 프랑스에게는 위협이었다. 비시 정부의 많은 각료들은 영국이 프랑스를 그들이 필요한 때에 버렸다고 느꼈다. 덩케르트의 철수작전과 본토 방어를 위한 전투기 편대의 철수는 비시정부의 각료들에게 쓴맛을 남겼다. 하지만 더 심한 상황이 다가오고 있었다. 프랑스가 가진 적도부근의 아프리카 식민지는 영국으로 망명한 드골이 지원하는 자유 프랑스 정권으로 넘어갔다. 비시 프랑스는 적으로 둘러싸여 있다. 이럴 때 정부는 무엇을 할 수 있을까?
French: The History of Modern France is shaped around three Key events. The Paris Commune (1871) the meat grinder of Verdun (1916) and the surrender to Germany (1940). The France that entered the war in 1939 was not the France of 1914. There was no Union Sacree rather a country bitterly divided against itself. A country that since Blum's popular Front government of 1934 had been polarised between right and left. The rallying cry of the French right was 'rather Hitler than Blum'. As the German armies marched through France a new fear began to arise in the French right fear of another Commune. The aging Marshal Petain hero of Verdun who was old enough to remember the commune was determined to ensure that it never happened again. Petain assumed political control determined to save France again. The new French regime made a speedy peace with Germany and based itself around the spa town of Vichy after which it would be named. Roughly half the territory of France was either annexed or occupied by the victors there were heavy reparations to be paid and the vultures were circling around France's colonial empire. The Japanese stood ready to occupy Indochina the Italians had ambitions against Tunis the Spanish looked to expand into Morocco and eventually the Germans would probably demand to have their colonies in central Africa back. The Axis powers and their ideological allies were a threat to France. Many of the leaders of Vichy felt that Britain had abandonded France in her hour of need. The evacuation at Dunkirk and the decision to hold back fighter squadrons for home defence left a bitter taste in the mouths of the Vichy leaders but worse was still to come. French equatorial Africa defected to De Gaul's British supported Free France regime. Vichy is surrounded by enemies - what can the government do?

English: 다마스쿠스(661)와 후에 바그다드(762)에 칼리프의 자리로부터 멀리 떨어진 거리는 예멘을 아랍-무슬림세계에서 주변적인 역할에 머무르게 했다. (칼리프가 있는 우마미야 왕조의 수도는 다마스쿠스, 아바스 왕조의 수도는 바그다드였다) 822년, 예멘은 아바스의 칼리프로부터 떨어져 나가기 시작했고, 945년 독립을 선언했다. 그 때부터 부분적으로 지리적, 경제적 이유-북부에선 임업과 농업을, 남부에선 해양 무역을-로 예멘의 북부와 남부는 서로 분열되기 시작했다. 더구나, 종교적이고 지정학적인 문제들도 부채질했다. 시아파가 북부를 지배한 반면에, 수니파는 남부를 지배했다. 영향력을 얻기 위한 외세의 시도들은 전략적으로 더 중요한 남부에 집중됨에 따라 결국 영국이 1839년 아덴(Aden)을 정복했다. 반면에, 홍해에서 프랑스의 팽창을 막기 위해 전념하고 있던 영국의 승인에 따라 오스만제국이 1849년 북예멘의 해안을, 1872년 산악지역을 점령하기 전까지 북부는 대부분의 기간을 평화롭게 지냈다. 1914년 현재, 예멘은 오스만의 보호 아래 남아있다.
French: The distance to the seat of the Caliph in Damascus (661) and later in Baghdad (762) provided Yemen a peripheral role in the Arab-Muslim world. In 822 Yemen began to break away from the Abbasides Caliphate declaring independence in 945. From there on the northern and southern Yemen began moving apart from each other partly for geographical and economical reasons - mountains and agriculture in the north with sea trade in the south. Additionally religious and strategic-political issues played a role. Shiites dominated in the north whilst Sunnites dominated in the south. Foreign attempts of taking influence were focused on the strategically more important south with Britain eventually conquering Aden in 1839. Meanwhile the north was left in peace for the most part until the Ottoman Empire took the coast of North Yemen in 1849 and the highlands in 1872 with approval from the British who were intent on containing French expansion on the Red Sea. As of 1914 Yemen remains under the Ottoman umbrella.

English: The distance to the seat of the Caliph in Damascus (661) and later in Baghdad (762) provided Yemen in the Arab-Muslim world with a role on the rim. In 822 Yemen began breaking away from the Abbasides Caliphate declaring independence in 945. From there on the northern and southern Yemen began moving apart from each other. The reasons were in part geographical and economical - mountains and agriculture in the north sea trade in the south. Additionally religious and strategic-political issues played a role. In the north Shiites dominated in the south Sunnites. Foreign attempts of taking influence were focused on the strategically more important south with Britain eventually conquering Aden in 1839. The north was left in peace for the most part until the Ottoman Empire took the coast of North Yemen in 1849 and the highlands in 1872 with approval from the British who were intent on containing French expansion on the Red Sea. After World war One and the breaking up of the Ottoman Empire Northern Yemen declared its independence in 1918. The land was ruled by an Imam spiritual and secular leader in one. In 1934 the opposition of the Free Yemenites was formed who would in future become more and more radical.
French: The distance to the seat of the Caliph in Damascus (661) and later in Baghdad (762) provided Yemen in the Arab-Muslim world with a role on the rim. In 822 Yemen began breaking away from the Abbasides Caliphate declaring independence in 945. From there on the northern and southern Yemen began moving apart from each other. The reasons were in part geographical and economical - mountains and agriculture in the north sea trade in the south. Additionally religious and strategic-political issues played a role. In the north Shiites dominated in the south Sunnites. Foreign attempts of taking influence were focused on the strategically more important south with Britain eventually conquering Aden in 1839. The north was left in peace for the most part until the Ottoman Empire took the coast of North Yemen in 1849 and the highlands in 1872 with approval from the British who were intent on containing French expansion on the Red Sea. After World war One and the breaking up of the Ottoman Empire Northern Yemen declared its independence in 1918. The land was ruled by an Imam spiritual and secular leader in one. In 1934 the opposition of the Free Yemenites was formed who would in future become more and more radical.

English: 1941년의 침공 후 독일은 크로아티아 괴뢰국을 세웠다. 이어서 독일 이탈리아 헝가리 불가리아는 유고슬라비아의 나머지 영토를 나눠가졌다. 하지만 곧 수많은 빨치산 조직이 생겨나기 시작했으며 요시프 브로즈 티토 (Josip Broz Tito)가 이끄는 공산주의자 빨치산 세력이 추축국에 대항하는 빨치산 세력의 주력이 되었다. 1944년 9월 붉은군대가 유고슬라비아 국경 근처에 도달하였을 때 티토는 비밀히 모스크바에 방문하여 붉은 군대가 유고슬라비아에 쉬이 진입할 수 있게 손을 써두었다. 그리고 붉은군대는 유고슬라비아가 안전해 지는 즉시 아무런 내정간섭 없이 떠날 것이라는 스탈린의 보장도 얻어냈다. 이제 티토 휘하의 공산당은 전쟁의 화염에서 벗어나 유고슬라비아의 유일한 통치세력이 되었다. 하지만 유고슬라비아가 소련의 간접 통치를 무효로 했음에도 스탈린은 그의 군대를 철수시키는 것을 거절하고 되려 유고슬라비아를 이탈리아 침공을 위한 발판으로 삼으려고 하고 있다. 유고슬라비아를 기다리는 운명은 무엇인가?
French: After the invasion of 1941 Germany created the puppet state of Croatia. Germany Italy Hungary and Bulgaria dismembered the remainder of Yugoslavia. However a number of partisan organizations soon arose. The communist Partisans led by the Partisan leader Josip Broz Tito became the major force in the resistance against the Axis. When the Red Army reached the Yugoslav border in September 1944 Tito travelled secretly to Moscow arranged for the Red Army to enter Yugoslavia and secured Stalin's word that it would leave the country once it was secure without interfering with domestic politics. Now the communists under Tito have emerged from the war as sole rulers of Yugoslavia. And while Yugoslavia has avoided indirect Soviet rule Stalin has refused to remove Red Army troops and is using Yugoslavia as a jumping off point for the invasion of Italy. What fate awaits Yugoslavia?

English: 이미 세계 1차 대전 중이었던 1917년에 남부 슬라브족의 국가의 설립은 동의 되었었다. 그러나 크로아티아인몬테네그로인 그리고 슬로베니아인은 이탈리아의 합병의 위협의 압박으로 오직 알렉산더 1세가 통치하는 “세르비아 크로아티아 슬로베니아 왕국” 만 인정했다. 1921년의 첫 번째 국가 헌법은 다양한 종교와 국가의 전통이 세르비아인의 지배에 놓이게 되어 첫 번째 유고슬라비아인의 국가가 성립되었다. 크로아티아 농민당은 베오그라드의 의회에 참가를 거부하고 연방화를 요구 하였다. 1925년에 그들을 포섭한 니콜라 파식의 정부도 차이점들을 극복할 수는 없었다. 1928년에 스테판 라딕과 두명 이상의 농민당 대표자는 몬테네그로의 대표적인 세르비아 급진 인민당에게 암살 당했다. 알렉산더 1세는 헌법을 중지하고 1929년에 통합을 완성하기위한 군주독재를 실시하였다. 왕국의 이름은 유고슬라비아로 바뀌었고 지리적인 편성에 따라 행정상의 구역을 규정지었고 이는 세르비안인 들에게 계속 정치적인 영향력을 갖게 하였고 그로 인해 크로아티아인은 급진적인 강경민족주의 단체인 우스타샤를 1929년에 설립하였다. 1934년에 일어난 알렉산더 1세의 암살은 허약한 나라로 하여금 내전의 위험의 가장자리에 서게 하였다.
French: Already during World War One in 1917 the founding of a south Slavic state was agreed upon. However Croats Montenegrinians and Slovenians only accepted Alexander I as ruler of the 'Kingdom of the Serbs Croats and Slovenians' under the pressure of Italian threats of annexion. The first constitution of 1921 laid down Serbian predominance so that the various religions and state traditions doomed the first Yugoslavian state. The Croat Farmers' Party boycotted the parliament in Belgrade and demanded a federalisation. Even their inclusion in the government of Nikola Pasic in 1925 could not overcome the differences. In 1928 Stefan Radic and two more delegates of the Farmers' Party were assassinated by a Montenegrinian representative of the Serbian Radical People's Party. King Alexander I suspended the constitution and and introduced a monarchical dictatorship in 1929 that was to enforce integration top down. The renaming of the kingdom into Yugoslavia and the establishment of geographically defined administrative entities (Banats) helped little as the Serbs continued to dominate the political life and as the Croats took radical measures founding the ultra-national Ustasha in 1929. The assassination of King Alexander I in 1934 brought the fragile country to the brink of civil war.

English: 러일 전쟁 (1904)
French: Russo-Japanese war (1904)

English: With the Trans-Siberian Railway almost finished Russian expansion into the Far East will soon be unstoppable. Large areas have already been annexed from China and Manchuria is falling under our domination.  The vital warm-water harbour at Port Arthur acquired from Japan ten years ago is the centrepiece of our power in the region.  Nothing can be allowed to challenge our control of the city.
French: With the Trans-Siberian Railway almost finished Russian expansion into the Far East will soon be unstoppable. Large areas have already been annexed from China and Manchuria is falling under our domination.  The vital warm-water harbour at Port Arthur acquired from Japan ten years ago is the centrepiece of our power in the region.  Nothing can be allowed to challenge our control of the city.

English: Ten years ago Japan won a historic victory over China only to see the arrogant Russians steal the prize - Port Arthur - away from us.  Now the time for revenge is at hand.  However Japan is badly outnumbered and we must strike swiftly and decisively to win a victory before Russia's full might can be brought to bear.

However Japan is badly outnumbered and we must strike swiftly and decisively to win a victory before Russia's full might can be brought to bear.

English: After years of military buildup and peaceful expansion Hitler has set his eyes on the next target-Poland. The Danzig Corridor separating East Prussia from the Reich is but an excuse for the destruction of the Polish state which will be the first test of German arms and show the world a new term-Blitzkrieg.
French: After years of military buildup and peaceful expansion Hitler has set his eyes on the next target-Poland. The Danzig Corridor separating East Prussia from the Reich is but an excuse for the destruction of the Polish state which will be the first test of German arms and show the world a new term-Blitzkrieg.

English: After Austria and Czechoslovakia there is little doubt that Poland will be the next target for Hitler's aggression. Isolated and stuck between two hostile nations Poland's chances are slim although its soldiers are brave and willing to sacrifice their lives for their nation.
French: After Austria and Czechoslovakia there is little doubt that Poland will be the next target for Hitler's aggression. Isolated and stuck between two hostile nations Poland's chances are slim although its soldiers are brave and willing to sacrifice their lives for their nation.

English: Accepting the terms of the Ribbentrop-Molotov Pact (signed on August 23 1939) Stalin decided to support Hitler's Germany in their war againstPoland. The Polish Army forced to fight a two-front war won't stand a chance against Red Army forces but completing the entire operation rapidly is the key - a prolonged campaign could cause a negative international reaction.
French: Accepting the terms of the Ribbentrop-Molotov Pact (signed on August 23 1939) Stalin decided to support Hitler's Germany in their war againstPoland. The Polish Army forced to fight a two-front war won't stand a chance against Red Army forces but completing the entire operation rapidly is the key - a prolonged campaign could cause a negative international reaction.

English: The newly independent Slovakian state has much to thank Hitler for and has willingly committed its small forces to the campaign in Poland. The Slovaks want to demonstrate their value as allies in the German cause and their effort might just make the difference should things develop other than as expected.
